<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=563) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 185 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetypes** [Assassin](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=48) (Level 6), [Poisoner](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=71) (Level 6), [Drow Shootist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=90) (Level 8)

**Requirements**
You are wielding a piercing or slashing weapon.

</column>

---

You apply a poison to the required weapon; if you have a free hand, you can Interact to draw a [poison](/equipment/alchemical-items/alchemical-poisons) as part of this action. If your next attack with that weapon before the end of your next turn hits and deals damage, it applies the effects of the poison, provided that poison can be delivered by [contact](/Traits.aspx?ID=37) or [injury](/Traits.aspx?ID=97). If you critically fail the attack roll, the poison is wasted as normal.

**Special** During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your rogue level. These poisons deal 1d4 poison damage. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.

<title level="2">Poison Weapon leads to...</title>
[Improved Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=573)
